teaching.topicContent: Review verb tenses and focus on the simple present, past, and future tenses. Provide examples and practice conjugating regular verbs in these tenses.

teaching.topicTitle: Verb 'To be': Past, Present, and Future
teaching.topicContent: Expand on the verb 'to be' by covering its usage in the past, present, and future tenses. Provide examples and practice conjugating the verb.
Introduce present participles as the -ing form of verbs and explain their usage in continuous tenses and gerund phrases. Practice using present participles in sentences.
Teach the present continuous tense (is/are + verb-ing) and its usage to describe ongoing actions. Provide examples and practice forming sentences in this tense.
Introduce the past continuous tense (was/were + verb-ing) and its usage to describe actions in progress in the past. Provide examples and practice forming sentences.
Focus on proper nouns related to places, such as cities, countries, and landmarks. Teach the capitalization rules for these proper nouns.
Introduce proper adjectives derived from proper nouns (e.g., American, Chinese) and teach their usage. Practice using proper adjectives in sentences.
Review speech marks (quotation marks) and their usage in dialogue. Teach the rules for punctuating quoted speech within a sentence.
Delve deeper into using speech marks with multiple speakers, direct and indirect speech, and different types of punctuation inside quotes.
Introduce the future continuous tense (will be + verb-ing) and its usage to describe actions that will be in progress at a specific future time. Provide examples and practice.
Teach the suffixes -less (without) and -ful (full of) and how they change the meaning of words. Provide examples and practice forming words with these suffixes.
Introduce adverbs and their role in describing verbs, adjectives, and other adverbs. Teach how to form adverbs by adding -ly to adjectives.
Explore how nouns can function as adjectives to describe other nouns. Provide examples of noun-adjective pairs and guide students in using them.
Teach how to form adjectives by adding -y to nouns. Practice using these adjectives to describe nouns in sentences.
Introduce irregular plural nouns that don't follow the typical -s or -es pattern. Teach students to recognize and use these irregular plurals correctly.
Explore continuous tenses (past continuous, present continuous, future continuous) and explain how they describe ongoing actions.

test.description: Put your Grammar knowledge to the test.
